tags: i'm all crossed eye at this point

summary: Shadows 15/16
title: Shadows 15/16
body:
So remember how I said I was going to post both chapters at once? Well, forget it! This one alone is almost 40 pages long *lol* So, I’ll save the rest for the ‘grand finale’. Sit back, tuck in, and digest. Hope it’s worth the wait. :D

(Breaking the Chains Excerpt)

“You’re making a big mistake!” she screamed and pounded his chest. “You know you are! Besides, that idiot who called me mentioned something about not wanting you to be with her anyway.”

“That…idiot?” Jon frowned.

“Oh, dear gods,” Cersei groaned and flopped against him again, her voice muffled against his chest. “What was his name again, Jaime?”

“Jorah Mormont,” Jaime replied with a shrug. He was standing up now to stretch and yawn. “He’s the one you should be concerned about. Looks like he’s threatening to take her back to Braavos or at least get you arrested or something of the sort.”

Jon’s jaw worked, his hands forming tight fists. His concern for Dany now was tenfold, and a quick glance at the grandfather clock showed that it was almost nine. Jorah was probably back home and was now-

“Do you want us to take care of him?” Cersei slurred. “We can take care of him, you know.”

“What do you mean take care of him?” Jon asked incredulously.

Cersei lifted her head, a sloppy smile on her face. “Men like Jorah Mormont think they can control their puppets. I’ve seen assholes like him a thousand times. Look…if we take care of him, will you remain working with us?”

“If you’re thinking of killing-”

“Hah!” Cersei snorted while Jaime chuckled and shook his head.

“We don’t have to kill him,” her brother explained. “There are many other ways to ruin one’s life.”

Continue on AO3

Thanks as always to the wonderful @annagreengrass​ for helping to bring this story to life with her lovely moodboards!

summary: Dragonstone is a volcanic island in the Narrow Sea that guards the entrance to Blackwater Bay and the sea approaches to King's...
caption: Dragonstone is a volcanic island in the Narrow Sea that guards the entrance to Blackwater Bay and the sea approaches to King’s Landing, off the east coast of Westeros. It is the location of the eponymous castle of Dragonstone, the ancestral seat of House Targaryen.

summary:
When  Dany and Jon spoke  in Dragonstone  there is only two dragon on the sky. 
Rhaegal and Viseryon
Why? There is only...
body:
When Dany and Jon spoke in Dragonstone there is only two dragon on the sky.

Rhaegal and Viseryon

Why? There is only Targaryen family.

Dany ,Jon,Rhaegar and Viserys

Not a Drogon-> khal Drogo

This is imitation of their family situation. They are family. They are some blood.

tags: a song of ice and fire
the more I read the books
summary: arya stark and her wolf’s blood
title: arya stark and her wolf’s blood
body:
I just wanted to point out something that maybe all of you have realized before, but Arya defending the butcher’s boy from Joffrey is the perfect simetry to Lyanna deffending Howland from those squires! I mean, sure, the outcome was different but here we have two girls who look incredibly similar, both highborn “ladies” who refuse to “behave properly” and that will beat up no matter who, highborn or low, to make justice. 

A little reminder as well that Arya was only 9 years old in the books, and 10 in the show! Lyanna herself was something between 14 and 15 years old. It takes a particular kind of courage to face someone in such situation they found themselves at, and even a greater one in face of “powerful people” and these girls didn’t even flinch or think twice before acting on how they thought they should! 

They are so much more similar than in looks, I just wanted to appreciate that and as Ned said: 

“Ah, Arya. You have a wildness in you, child. ‘The wolf blood,’ my father used to call it. Lyanna had a touch of it, and my brother Brandon more than a touch. It brought them both to an early grave.” Arya heard sadness in his voice; he did not often speak of his father, or of the brother and sister who had died before she was born. “Lyanna might have carried a sword, if my lord father had allowed it.You remind me of her sometimes. You even look like her.”

“Lyanna was beautiful,” Arya said, startled. Everybody said so. It was not a thing that was ever said of Arya.

“She was,” Eddard Stark agreed, “beautiful, and willful, and dead before her time.”

Makes it all the more beautiful the fact that Arya was Jon’s favorite person in the whole world growing up, It’s like a piece of his mother was always there with him. Loving and being his best friend!

This is probably just obvious to everyone out there, but I just wanted to appreciate that beautiful fact, thanks for coming to my TED talk! :)

Now if you’ll excuse me, I’m going to go around the corner and cry my eyes out.

bye.

summary: Hello, How do you feel about Jon Snow the Lord of Sea Dragon Point and/or Stoney Shore? I asked racefortheironthrone about this...
question: Hello, How do you feel about Jon Snow the Lord of Sea Dragon Point and/or Stoney Shore? I asked racefortheironthrone about this and each of them are about as big as the Iron Islands. I doubt Princess Regent Elia would stand for giving Jon land, to much Blackfyre history, but Rhaegar can just ignore that much easier than Elia. If Jon does a bunch of work against the Others then a reward seems to be in order. Assuming if he doesn't take vows to the Night's Watch. Thanks.
answer:
Nope.

You don’t give a high born bastard any legitimacy what so ever. Certainly not lands and a lordship in the region his powerful relatives reside.

Jon was born as the direct result of a war that killed thousands. Rhaegar favoring his bastard after forcing Elia and her children to remain as hostages under Aerys? Wanting to raise him up as royalty? Elia is no Naerys; she wouldn’t wait for Rhaegar to recreate the Blackfyres. There would a successful ‘accident’ and regent Elia makes a large gift to the Faith and baby Jon goes to be a septon.

And any work against the Others would require Jon to take vows and join the Night’s Watch. Even in late canon, very few people actually believe they exist beyond the wildings and the men who survived the Great Ranging.

Wanting to raise him up as royalty? Elia is no Naerys; she wouldn’t wait for Rhaegar to recreate the Blackfyres. There would a successful ‘accident’ and regent Elia makes a large gift to the Faith and baby Jon goes to be a septon.

And any work against the Others would require Jon to take vows and join the Night’s Watch. Even in late canon, very few people actually believe they exist beyond the wildings and the men who survived the Great Ranging.
trail.content:
Nope.

You don’t give a high born bastard any legitimacy what so ever. Certainly not lands and a lordship in the region his powerful relatives reside.

Jon was born as the direct result of a war that killed thousands. Rhaegar favoring his bastard after forcing Elia and her children to remain as hostages under Aerys? Wanting to raise him up as royalty? Elia is no Naerys; she wouldn’t wait for Rhaegar to recreate the Blackfyres. There would a successful ‘accident’ and regent Elia makes a large gift to the Faith and baby Jon goes to be a septon.

And any work against the Others would require Jon to take vows and join the Night’s Watch. Even in late canon, very few people actually believe they exist beyond the wildings and the men who survived the Great Ranging.

summary: Jon Snow drabble Stand my ground by Within Temptations, please said yes!
question: Jon Snow drabble Stand my ground by Within Temptations, please said yes!
answer:
Characters: Reader x Jon Snow
Warnings: Mentions of death
Lyric: “But I won’t run, there’s no turning back from here”
Word Count: 351
A/N: I think this is my first Game of Thrones drabble for this celebration!! Sorry if it’s inaccurate

NOT TAKING ANYMORE REQUESTS!

The horses trotted at a steady pace as Jon and Davos headed for the harbour, preparing for their trip to Dragonstone. While Jon initially hadn’t planned to follow up on Tyrion’s letter, and subsequently meet Daenerys, Samwell’s discovery of the dragonglass on Dragonstone had drastically changed the situation. 

Jon knew his decision was met with disapproval, especially from Sansa. Nonetheless, dragonglass was crucial to defeat the White Walkers, which were becoming a bigger and bigger threat with each passing day. There was no time to waste.

Jon and Davos stiffened when they simultaneously heard the pounding of hooves, and they turned to see you galloping up to them. Jon’s eyebrows furrowed – you had opted to remain in Winterfell with Sansa, since you also didn’t approve of Jon’s departure. 

So what were you doing here?

“y/n,” Jon glanced at you, confused, as you rode to his side. “I thought you weren’t coming.”

“I still think it’s a trap.” you replied gruffly, gathering your reins in hand as you caught your breath. Jon chuckled slightly, a hollow sound. Perhaps it was a trap, but these were desperate times.

“That doesn’t explain why you’re here.” Jon pointed out, and you let out a sigh.

“We’ve come this far, Jon, I can’t turn back now. I can’t run away any longer.” you responded. “Daenerys scares me, but the White Walkers and the Night King scare me more – I can’t stay in Winterfell and do nothing if there’s a chance we gain achieve something in Dragonstone. So I’m here to help you, and to also possibly protect you if Daenerys is luring you to Dragonstone to capture you.”

Jon smiled at you, a genuine smile which stretched across his face. No matter the circumstances, he found you always had his back. No matter the disagreements, no matter the odds. 

“Thank you, y/n.” Jon nodded at you, his voice low. Having your support meant a lot more to him that he’d care to admit. 

“Of course.” you replied, before bowing dramatically, causing a chuckle to escape Jon’s lips. “Anything for the King in the North.”
